title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 March 2014 - XWiki
content:

09:36 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
09:45 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <fmancinelli> Hi, quick question... Is the HQL query of a database list property velocity-interpreted?  
09:53 <ClemensR> I think normally it is not interpreted, it depends on how you output the values  
09:54 <fmancinelli> what I mean, is if \*before\* executing the query, velocity is run on the query string in order to expand variables  
09:56 <ClemensR> ah, yes, it should, if it is not single quited or the like  
09:57 <fmancinelli> ok thanks  
10:00 <ClemensR> ie.e. #set($query = "... here some text with $vars ...")   $services.query.hql($query)  ... etc pp  
10:02 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:03 <polx> has quit  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:04 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <fmancinelli> ClemensR: I was talking about the HQL query specified in a class database list property definition :) Anyway it works... I was just forgetting to put some '' which lead to an invalid query  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <ClemensR> ah, ok, I somewhat misunder stood but it worked anyway :)  
10:09 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: hi  
10:09 <gdelhumeau> You know what I'm going to ask :)  
10:09 <mflorea> Hi gdelgumeau, you can proceed with the release  
10:09 <mflorea> :)  
10:09 <spu7nic> Hi :)  
10:10 <gdelhumeau> ok so I shoudl also create a 5.4.4 version on JIRA?  
10:10 <mflorea> yes  
10:10 <cjd> I think this is worth reading: https://blogs.law.harvard.edu/vrm/2012/02/21/stop-making-cows-stop-being-calves/  
10:10 <gdelhumeau> thanks :)  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:27 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] Releasing 5.4.3  
10:40 <cjd> mflorea: very interesting close of 10169, I kind of suspected it was not ours but I just threw it there to check  
10:40 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <mflorea> cjd: I close it because I doubt someone will try to fix it by implementing a custom list insertion command in the WYSIWYG editor. Plus we're going to evaluate the integration of an external editor, like ckeditor, so I don't think it's worth spending time on this issue.  
10:43 <mflorea> it's interesting to check though if other editors like ckeditor has this issue, i.e. if other editor have a custom link insertion code and don't rely on the default browser command  
10:43 <cjd> yeah, I opened it to document the fact that it happens :)  
10:44 <cjd> but it's very interesting  
11:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <woshilapin> has quit

12:18 <sacha\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:19 <sacha\_> Hey guys, I have a Xwiki auth issue - can't login in XWiki (using an OAuth patch), I'm getting an infinite redirect loop. anybody got that already?  
12:36 <vmassol> (xwiki.org is crashing a lot)  
12:42 <woshilapin> has quit  
12:46 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
13:24 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:30 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
13:39 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <tmortagne> msmeria: would be nice if you could review and finish http://xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki60M1#HTestedBrowsers26Databases  
13:46 <msmeria> tmortagne: I will later, because now I'm testing migrations on 5.4.3  
13:47 <tmortagne> ok  
13:50 <vmassol> has quit  
13:57 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <fmancinelli> yep. But apparently there's $services.wiki.currentWikiId which does the same thing and is more intuitive  
13:58 <fmancinelli> at least it doesn't speak of 'databases' :)  
13:58 <tmortagne> yes the method name always been wrong  
13:58 <tmortagne> did not know gdelhumeau added this method in wiki script service  
13:59 <spu7nic> has quit  
13:59 <tmortagne> now I'm sure you will find people not finding "$services.wiki.currentWikiId" very intuitive ;)  
13:59 <gdelhumeau> why?  
14:00 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <tmortagne> because they expect to find contextual information in the context  
14:02 <tmortagne> (I'm the kind of dev that also find $services.wiki.currentWikiId better, but I'm sure it's not a universal view)  
14:03 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: by the way if $xcontext.database is not the right way anymore it's should be deprecated  
14:03 <gdelhumeau> I avoid using it in pages  
14:03 <gdelhumeau> but currentWikiId actually returns xcontext.database  
14:04 <gdelhumeau> what is the new way?  
14:05 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I'm talking about API here, not implementation  
14:05 <tmortagne> if the right API is $services.wiki.currentWikiId then that's what should be used in case we store the current wiki somewhere else than in the old XWikiContext  
14:06 <tmortagne> if $xcontext.database is the right wat, it makes  $services.wiki.currentWikiId useless  
14:08 <tmortagne> (and no currentWikiId is not using api.Context#getDatabase, it  does the same thing)  
14:11 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] Build is done, you can commit in stable-5.4.x now  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> XWIki.Org is very slow so I don't want  to publish that 5.4.3 is released right now  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> if we don't want people to experience bad performances in xwiki.org  
14:21 <spu7nic> What would be considered best practice for relations between two classes (1-n)? Adding a reference property to the "child" class? DBList on the parent class?  
14:23 <spu7nic> And is it possible to enforce the \_1\_-n with DBLists?  
14:35 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <vmassol> stopping xwiki.org for upgrade  
15:03 <vmassol> don't upgrade a subwiki please I made a mistake  
15:03 <vmassol> restarting xwiki.org  
15:07 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: if you have any idea: we have tons of such error in the logs when starting xwiki.org: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/9783947/raw/367c5a871b3fd302f49c7cf04db2cfcd44717e57/gistfile1.txt  
15:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: not really, according to the code that would mean this.componentManager.getInstance(Job.class, "distribution") returned null...  
15:11 <tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-distribution/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/distribution/internal/DefaultDistributionManager.java#L216  
15:11 <vmassol> that's possible  
15:11 <tmortagne> ha no wrong line  
15:12 <vmassol> when xwiki is started but before the statci CM has been set maybe  
15:12 <vmassol> (that would return a NPE not null)  
15:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: this has nothing t do with Utils#getComponent  
15:12 <vmassol> doing too many things at once  
15:12 <tmortagne> this.componentManager.getInstance(Job.class, "distribution")  
15:12 <vmassol> finishing the upgrade  
15:12 <tmortagne> that means ComponentManager#getInstance returned null  
15:12 <tmortagne> this is not really possible  
15:13 <tmortagne> there is no static to initialize here  
15:23 <vmassol> having a hard time…  
15:23 <vmassol> :)  
15:23 <vmassol> I must be tired  
15:49 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
16:03 <tmortagne> spu7nic: you want to import a document through REST api ?  
16:04 <vmassol> ok I know why xwiki.org is slow now, it 's the DW  
16:04 <vmassol> it's using all threads  
16:04 <tmortagne> spu7nic: there is an API to import a XAR through REST, it's documented in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XWikiRESTfulAPI but xwiki.org is being upgraded  
16:04 <vmassol> pgrading extensions wiki  
16:05 <vmassol> we'll need to fix this  
16:06 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't understand what you mean  
16:06 <vmassol> all threads are locked by: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/9785470/raw/f895bb1510bde2896a6828ee8617390514a94247/gistfile1.txt  
16:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: you can check the dump.txt file in my home directory on xwiki.org  
16:10 <vmassol> who's running the DW?  
16:10 <tmortagne> not me  
16:10 <vmassol> grrrrr  
16:11 <vmassol> mflorea: I'm stuck I think  
16:11 <vmassol> I tried to upgrade the xclams subwiki and the DW reported it was going to remove some pages  
16:11 <vmassol> I kept only 1 to remove and 2 unchecked and clicked continue  
16:12 <vmassol> since then I'm sutck and the log is not moving  
16:15 <spu7nic> tmortagne: I already noticed that one … but since it takes some time to import, it may be possible to directly post to a page ^^  
16:15 <mflorea> vmassol: the server was probably responding very slow, that's why the job wasn't progressing  
16:15 <vmassol> xwiki iported 20 XAR in between!ç  
16:15 <vmassol> \*imported  
16:15 <vmassol> as you can see above  
16:16 <vmassol> it started around 16:09  
16:16 <tmortagne> if all HTTP thread are stuck then you can't refresh the UI  
16:16 <spu7nic> tmortagne: but I couldn't find any URI which accepts the xar-xml format :/  
16:17 <mflorea> vmassol: the above messages are not for the xclam wiki  
16:17 <mflorea> not only  
16:17 <vmassol> indeed, Ididn't upgrade design so it must have been soemone else  
16:17 <vmassol> still  
16:17 <vmassol> but thomas must be right  
16:17 <vmassol> about the ui requiring some thread to update  
16:18 <vmassol> RULE: never ever upgrade xwiki while it's running,it's not working  
16:18 <vmassol> :(  
16:18 <tmortagne> it's not supposed to be stuck  
16:18 <tmortagne> need to be debugged  
16:18 <tmortagne> it used to work very well  
16:19 <mflorea> unless she has admin right (which she doesn't remember) there might be a problem  
16:20 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <vmassol> ok that would explain why all threads are used because I cannot understand this  
16:20 <vmassol> can someone with non admin rights ((but logged in) check if he sees the DW?  
16:23 <mflorea> vmassol: I checked with Victor, he doesn't see the DW (he's logged in with a non-admin user)  
16:23 <vmassol> ok thanks  
16:24 <circ-user-4iXRu> has joined #xwiki  
16:24 <circ-user-4iXRu> is now known as <kubaplas>  
16:26 <kubaplas> Hi, does anybody know when xwiki.org will be working again? Can I install now xwiki on my server? About an hour ago installation has failed, because some packages couldn't be downloaded.  
16:27 <vmassol> kubaplas: yes we're upgrading xwiki.org ATM and we're having some problems sorry about that  
16:27 <vmassol> I'm on it ATM  
16:27 <kubaplas> What about repositories? Am I safe to try installation?  
16:28 <vmassol> no  
16:28 <vmassol> well  
16:28 <vmassol> depends  
16:28 <tmortagne> not extensions but you can install standard XE  
16:28 <vmassol> the maven repo will answer  
16:29 <vmassol> (could take long though for extensions.xwiki.org to time out)  
16:29 <tmortagne> the standard UI is downloaded in maven repository so it should be ok  
16:29 <vmassol> I would recommend waiting a bit if you can  
16:29 <vmassol> ok I cannot progress on the install  
16:29 <vmassol> all threads are stuck  
16:29 <vmassol> I can ask infra to protect xwiki.org but this will remove activeinstalls recording too  
16:30 <Denis> has quit  
16:30 <tmortagne> activeinstall need to access the wiki ?  
16:30 <vmassol> no  
16:30 <vmassol> but apache yes  
16:31 <kubaplas> Ok, I'll try tomorrow then. Good luck on fixing the site ;)  
16:31 <tmortagne> the filter could be done only for the wiki  
16:32 <tmortagne> like closing apache connection with tomcat and then you can do the upgrade on tomcat directly  
16:33 <vmassol> GF is trying somethin  
16:33 <vmassol> something  
16:33 <tmortagne> in the meantime I'm trying to reproduce the lock  
16:37 <vmassol> restarting  
16:45 <msmeria> has quit  
16:48 <kubaplas> has quit  
16:52 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like empty status.xml  
16:53 <vmassol> could you check on xwiki.org?  
16:53 <tmortagne> and I'm pretty sure it was there already  
16:54 <tmortagne> working on lock before, this log is not really an issue from runtime point of view  
16:58 <vmassol> I'm now alone normally on xwiki.org but I still have access issues, taking another dump  
16:58 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: putting a patched jar on xwiki.org that should improve things  
17:01 <vmassol> ah ok great  
17:01 <tmortagne> (should not take long)  
17:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: done, I let your restart when you are ready  
17:05 <vmassol> ok restarting now  
17:08 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:08 <vmassol> your patch seems to be working tmortagne  
17:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: you will get DW on subwiki if there is something to do, maybe you tried on a subwiki with invalid extensions installed  
17:10 <vmassol> why do i get twice the jira macro to upgrade?  
17:10 <vmassol> screenshot:  
17:11 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/e664dd77-71a3-4858-86a8-ef667df9f1cc/16ebe328100f9e902f00887ecbd36c4c  
17:11 <vmassol> same for Repository API actually  
17:11 <vmassol> (I have it twice too)  
17:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: not in the same wiki  
17:12 <vmassol> upgrade on farm it says  
17:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: I get the DW on all subwikis even when there's nothing to do  
17:12 <vmassol> (just tested on commons)  
17:13 <tmortagne> you don't get any step ?  
17:13 <vmassol> and btw I get the Report step even though there was nothing to do...  
17:13 <vmassol> it checks for extensions to update and finds none  
17:13 <vmassol> so I have to manually go to each subwiki to finish the install  
17:13 <vmassol> even though I've upgraded from the main wiki's DW  
17:14 <tmortagne> vmassol: those wikis were probably acceded by somewhere before being upgraded from main wiki  
17:14 <tmortagne> s/somewhere/someone/  
17:14 <vmassol> no  
17:14 <tmortagne> which trigerred the DW  
17:14 <vmassol> I had the same issue last time  
17:15 <vmassol> and I was only on a clean VM  
17:15 <vmassol> s\*only/alone  
17:15 <vmassol> should be easy to reproduce  
17:15 <tmortagne> then it means you have invalid extension on all thoses wiki for which it does not find and valid upgrade  
17:15 <tmortagne> s/and/any/  
17:18 <tmortagne> for https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/e664dd77-71a3-4858-86a8-ef667df9f1cc/16ebe328100f9e902f00887ecbd36c4c it looks like a bug where the UI think an extension installed on root namespace is also on main wiki  
17:29 <gdelhumeau> vmassol, tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1362  
17:29 <gdelhumeau> that is why the main wiki descriptor has "localhost" in the server property  
17:30 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: yes I explained it to vmassol on Skype  
17:30 <vmassol> that doesn't help me :)  
17:30 <vmassol> as a user it's an issue  
17:31 <gdelhumeau> so before it was xwiki, now it is localhost  
17:31 <gdelhumeau> on xwiki.org, it was xwiki.org, badly merge to localhost.org  
17:31 <gdelhumeau> how can we fix it?  
17:31 <tmortagne> it's not badly merged, it's merged  
17:32 <tmortagne> only way to fix it is to not try to merge StringProperty  
17:32 <tmortagne> and then you get a conflict  
17:32 <tmortagne> (only way and EM level)  
17:32 <gdelhumeau> (btw, I was unable to deploy xwiki-commons and rendering again, for 5.4.3, even by using the maven machine instead of my own)  
17:34 <vmassol> other issue: not very nice: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/9787506/raw/c77a847a7fe6871076395347845d4ffae09f29ee/gistfile1.txt  
17:34 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10180 is a blocker IMO, either we restart 5.4.3 since you did not anounced it yet or we release a 5.4.4 right after  
17:35 <gdelhumeau> erf  
17:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: why other issue ? you already reported it  
17:35 <gdelhumeau> actually it was announced only on ow2  
17:35 <vmassol> did I? :)  
17:36 <gdelhumeau> I won't release something else today because I'm leaving soon  
17:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: (04:51:57 PM) vmassol: tmortagne: could you check this too when you have the time: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/9786523/raw/9dd66ecdce678f92d91fb33fd33f8deb5ed2a052/gistfile1.txt  
17:36 <tmortagne> it's the same  
17:36 <tmortagne> empty status.xml, it probably tried to load it again  
17:38 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: first we need to decide if we restart platform 5.4.3 release or if we want a new release. It does not have to be done by you, I can take care of this since it's my fault.  
17:38 <tmortagne> finishing release 5.4.3 seems pretty useless to me  
17:38 <tmortagne> vmassol ?  
17:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: was not an empty xml actually but an invalid one, probably generated when status serialization was not as protected as now  
17:41 <tmortagne> removed it  
17:41 <vmassol> wondering since gdelhumeau might not release before tomorrow so some users will have downloadeD/used 5.4.3  
17:42 <gdelhumeau> what I have done: create a blogpost on xwiki.org, update wikipedia, annonce the release on freecode, update wikimatrix, announce on ow2  
17:42 <vmassol> so they won't be able to upgrade automatically  
17:42 <gdelhumeau> I did not: send an announcement email, twitter, update the doc...  
17:42 <gdelhumeau> I have also updated Main.Download  
17:43 <tmortagne> if we restart 5.4.3 right now I doubt anyone will have the time to install it  
17:43 <vmassol> now?  
17:43 <gdelhumeau> only platform & entreprise needs to be built?  
17:43 <tmortagne> yes  
17:43 <tmortagne> as I said I can take care of it  
17:44 <vmassol> ah ok sounds good then if we do it very quickly  
17:44 <vmassol> I don't like it  
17:44 <vmassol> but ok  
17:44 <tmortagne> lets clean 5.4.3 stuff here and there first so that people don't find it  
17:50 <gdelhumeau> we also have  XWIKI-10181  
17:50 <vmassol> xwiki.org should be back for everyone  
17:50 <vmassol> please check all is ok  
17:51 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: this one could go in 5.4.4  
17:51 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: XWIKI-10181 does not looks like a quickfix even if not very nice indeed  
17:55 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: is it normal that XWIKI-10180 is closed as dup when there are commits in it?  
18:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: this is because the regression has been introduce in 5.4.3, see my last comment  
18:05 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:05 <vmassol> ah hmm so affects 5.4.2 is not correct I guess  
18:06 <tmortagne> no  
18:06 <vmassol> the issue shouldn't exist at all, it's invalid  
18:06 <vmassol> not sure how to handle this :)  
18:07 <vmassol> 5.4.3 is ok I guess  
18:14 <sdumitriu\_[Away]> is now known as <sdumitriu>  
18:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: the xwiki.org logs are full of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10182 would be nice to fix it relatively quickly  
18:32 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:40 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
18:43 <vmassol> has quit  
18:50 <cjd> has quit

19:21 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki

19:26 <sbaloul2> has quit  
19:27 <woshilapin> has quit  
19:46 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki
